fileUtils

Class FileReadWriteUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • fileUtils.FileReadWriteUtil

  • public class FileReadWriteUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to manage file reading / writing on the local file system, or streams from the GoogleDrive API.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FileReadWriteUtil() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.lang.String readFile(java.io.File f)
      Reads the contents of a given text file, and returns them as a string.
      static java.lang.String readStream(java.io.InputStream in)
      Reads a stream, and returns its contents as a string.
      static void writeFile(java.io.File f, java.lang.String s)
      Writes the given stream to the given file
      static void writeStream(java.io.OutputStream out, java.lang.String s)
      Writes the given string to an output stream.

                                   throws java.io.IOException
        Reads a stream, and returns its contents as a string.

        the contents of the given stream
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs while reading the stream

      • readFile

        public static java.lang.String readFile(java.io.File f)
                                 throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                        java.io.IOException
        Reads the contents of a given text file, and returns them as a string.
        Parameters:
        f - the file to read
        Returns:
        the text contents of the given file.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the given file does not exist on the local file system.
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs when reading the given file.

      • writeStream

        public static void writeStream(java.io.OutputStream out,
                               java.lang.String s)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the given string to an output stream.
        Parameters:
        out - the stream to write to.
        s - the string to write
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if any errors occur when writing to the stream.

      • writeFile

        public static void writeFile(java.io.File f,
                             java.lang.String s)
                      throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                             java.io.IOException
        Writes the given stream to the given file
        Parameters:
        f - the file to write to
        s - the string to write
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the given file does not exist on the user's local file system
        java.io.IOException - if any errors occur when writing to the file.
